com.tinfoil.sms.dataStructures

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinfoil.sms.dataStructures.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used to store information from the message table

      • SENT_DEFAULT

        public static final int SENT_DEFAULT
        Possible states: 0. Sent (no encryption) 1. Sent (encrypted) 2. Sent (encrypted and obfuscated) 3. Received (not encrypted, not expecting encryption) 4. Received (encrypted (implies that they were expecting it to be encrypted and it was successfully able to decrypt it)) 5. Received (HashMac failed, expecting encrypted but failed to decrypt) 6. Received (encrypted and obfuscated (implying again that they were expecting it such and succeeded in transforming it back to plain text)) 7. Received (de-obfuscation failed (not sure if this is possible)) 8. Received (de-obfuscated and failed to decrypt, Hash-Mac failed after de-obfuscation (not sure about this one either))
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message(java.lang.String message,
       long date,
       int type)
        A class for storing messages retrieved or to be stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        message - The body of the message
        date - The date the message was sent or received
        type - Whether the message is send or received, 1 means received, 2 means sent. *Please Note These values are based of the native application's send and received flags.

      • Message

        public Message(java.lang.String message,
       boolean currentTime,
       int sent)
        A class for storing messages retrieved or to be stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        message - The body of the message
        currentTime - Whether the date is set to the current time or not. If true date is set to current time, otherwise date is set to 0
        sent - Whether the message was sent or received. If sent = true then the message was sent otherwise the message was received

      • millisToDate

        public static java.lang.String millisToDate(long currentTime)
        Convert the current time in milliseconds to the current time formated as: YYYY/MM/DD HH:MM AM/PM
        Parameters:
        currentTime - The current time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        The current time formated.

      • isSent

        public boolean isSent()
        Check whether the message was sent or received
        Returns:
        If the message was sent it will return true, otherwise false.

      • getSent

        public int getSent()
        Get the send flag in terms of the native android messaging application this is more used to save messages back to the native application
        Returns:
        The flag of whether the message was sent or received. If the message was sent the return will be 2, otherwise the return will be 1.

      • getNativeSent

        public int getNativeSent()

      • setSent

        private void setSent(int sent)
        Set whether the message is sent or received
        Parameters:
        sent - Whether the message is now sent or received.
